input_text:
Job Title: Senior Art Buyer

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Art/Creative, Purchasing, Research

Description:
Primary FunctionWe're looking for someone to coordinate the research, acquisition, production, presentation, negotiation, copyright management, purchasing and tracking of images for advertising and marketing collateral. This includes research and management of outside vendors such as photographers, fine artists, illustrators and stock image sources.
Duties & ResponsibilitiesWorks with all agency functions internal and external clients to develop visual strategies and concepts for advertising and marketing collateralManages the creation of artwork (primarily photography & illustration) to provide visual solutionsResearches, sources, and identifies artists to be commissioned by the teamProvides comprehensive project management including job specification, budget parameters and communication of timelines for deadlinesProduces internal and external photo shoots and manages budget, props, location, etc.Assists in the management of image librariesTracks copyright information, vendor information and licensing parameters for all assetsActs as vendor partner and manages litigation riskMaintains an awareness of visual trendsAssists in providing Art Buying education to the agency as neededAdheres to established processes to ensure compliance on all jobsCurates assets within the Enterprise DAMRemains flexible and shares common goals with non-creative functions in the AgencyResolves conflicts within teams with grace and patience
Skills & QualificationsProficient in copyright law, negotiation and visual communicationStrong working knowledge of financial advertisingDemonstrated excellent leadership, organizational, communication and presentation skillsTeam orientedAbility to lead and influence in a cross-functional fast-paced team environmentAble to handle direction and criticismComputer proficiency including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint on Mac and PC platforms
Education & ExperienceBachelors degree or equivalent work experience7-10 years Art Buying work experienceExperience in client and vendor relations, along with negotiating skills and budget management
Diversity Inclusion & Customer Service StatementTeamPeople is an organization dedicated to providing superior customer service. Outstanding customer service encompasses everything from performing the technical, creative and operational aspects of our jobs to the best of our ability, to going the extra mile to assist our customers and colleagues in any way.
We respect, value and celebrate the unique attributes, characteristics and perspectives that make each person who they are. We also believe that bringing diverse individuals together allows us to collectively and more effectively address the issues that face our customers. It is our aim, therefore, that our partners, strategies and investments reflect these core values. TeamPeople is dedicated to providing superior customer service and is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, family care or medical leave status, genetic information, veteran status, marital status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
